intro: Gnaphalium leontopodinum, commonly known as the silky everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant is known for its fluffy, silver-gray foliage and its ability to produce a large number of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
